Class Account

java.lang.Object
  Account
Direct Known Subclasses:
CurrentAccount
public class Account
extends java.lang.Object

Account class used to model simple bank accounts, allowing money to be credited to, and debited and transfered from, an account.

Version:
1.0
Author:
M250 Module Team

Constructor Summary
Account()
          Constructor for objects of class Account.
Account(java.lang.String aHolder, java.lang.String aNumber, double aBalance)
          Constructor for objects of class Account which sets the values of holder, number and balance of the receiver to the arguments aHolder, aNumber and aBalance respectively.
 
Method Summary
 void credit(double anAmount)
          Credits the receiver with the value of the argument anAmount.
 boolean debit(double anAmount)
          If the balance of the receiver is equal to or greater than the argument anAmount, the balance of the receiver is debited by the argument anAmount and the method returns true.

public Account(java.lang.String aHolder,
               java.lang.String aNumber,

Constructor for objects of class Account which sets the values of holder, number and balance of the receiver to the arguments aHolder, aNumber and aBalance respectively.

Method Detail

credit

public void credit(double anAmount)
Credits the receiver with the value of the argument anAmount.

debit

public boolean debit(double anAmount)
If the balance of the receiver is equal to or greater than the argument anAmount, the balance of the receiver is debited by the argument anAmount and the method returns true. If the balance of the receiver is not equal to or greater than the argument anAmount, the method simply returns false.

getBalance

public double getBalance()
Returns the balance of the receiver.

getHolder

public java.lang.String getHolder()
Returns the holder of the receiver.

getNumber

public java.lang.String getNumber()
Returns the number of the receiver.

setBalance

public void setBalance(double aBalance)
Set the balance of the receiver to the value of the argument aBalance.

setHolder

public void setHolder(java.lang.String aHolder)
Set the holder of the receiver to the value of the argument aHolder.

setNumber

public void setNumber(java.lang.String aNumber)
Set the number of the receiver to the value of the argument aNumber.

transfer

public boolean transfer(Account toAccount,
                        double anAmount)
If the balance of the receiver is equal to or greater than the argument anAmount, the balance of the receiver is debited by the argument anAmount. The argument toAccount is then credited by the argument anAmount and the method returns true. If the balance of the receiver is not equal to or greater than the argument anAmount, the method simply returns false.
